title: Drawing, "Lady Esther Yacht: Furniture Layout", 1934–35
medium: Graphite on tracing paper, ruled border in graphite
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite on verso lower right: YACHT PERSPE
description: Perspective drawing of furniture and interior for Lady Esther Yacht. Partial view of box-frame sofa at far left with built-in side table at right. Side table has one shelf with open sides. Long horizontal shelving unit extends from side table along far wall, and becomes partition/side of entrance to staircase on the right. Two egg-shaped lounge chairs and coffee table in front of low bookshelf on far wall. Chairs have circular seat and back in form of arch. Chairs are low to ground and have no feet. Chair back slightly concaved to envelope back of sitter. Chair back forms armrests. Coffee table has circular top and base, with four straight posts to connect the sections. Entrance to staircase at right has four horizontal, tubular rails that connect to one vertical rail. Four rectangular windows in various sizes along far wall above shelving unit. Two large windows, or double door entrance on right wall near stairs. Low upholstered lounge chair in foreground at left, facing sofa. Low, square side table to right of lounge chair. Upholstered side chair in foreground at right. Seat and back continous, armrests attached to back and becomes front legs. Low wall partition with rounded corner to right of chair.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Lady Esther Yacht: Furniture Layout", 1934–35.
1934–35. Graphite on tracing paper, ruled border in graphite. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-310.
